Visit Stamford
==============

![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/1faa99a3-ceab-4d3c-b9c2-ce57d05c427a/19400646_1367102293374283_2648191312482185332_o.jpg)

Kick off your boots and stay awhile!
------------------------------------

When visiting Stamford, Texas, you’ll experience small-town, West Texas charm and a vibrant community spirit. Explore the town to discover local shops, a variety of local and chain restaurants, and historic sites. For a taste of the town's rich heritage, a visit to the Museum of the West Texas Frontier (open Friday-Saturday) is a must, offering insight into the area's cowboy culture and rodeo history. Nature enthusiasts can venture to the nearby Stamford Lake area for a peaceful day of fishing, picnicking, or simply enjoying the scenic views. Or catch a show at the historic Grand Theatre on the Square.

For more information about Stamford, visit [www.stamfordtx.org](https://www.stamfordtx.org/).

![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/9b2a2676-e681-429b-be29-db024c666524/481919614_633009472709913_8820903359292111014_n.jpg)

### Stop by our Official Visitor Center

[The Museum of the West Texas Frontier](https://museumofthewesttexasfrontier.com/) serves as our town’s “official Visitor Center” welcoming travelers from all over to get to know our town. Plan a stop on your weekend visit to find out more about our local culture, get information about local businesses, and buy some memorabilia to help support our small town’s history.

#### Museum of the West Texas Frontier

113 South Wetherbee Street, Stamford, Texas 79553, United States

Call: [325-773-2500](tel:3257732500)

Email: [westtexasfrontier@gmail.com](mailto:westtexasfrontier@gmail.com)

#### Hours

Friday - 10:00 am – 5:00 pm

Saturday - 10:00 am – 5:00 pm

Local Attractions
-----------------

* ![a historic chuckwagon exhibit at the Museum of the West Texas Frontier](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/499dd780-7b17-4bd3-b7d1-959522d403d3/museum+of+the+west+texas+frontier+exhibits.jpg)

  Museum of the West Texas Frontier
  ---------------------------------

  The Museum of the West Texas Frontier is the custodian of the heritage and culture of the frontier pioneers, providing engaging educational programs and exhibitions with the purpose of educating the present and future generations about its unique and rich history. Visit their website at [**www.museumofthewesttexasfrontier.com**](https://museumofthewesttexasfrontier.com)
* ![the Grand Theatre in Stamford lit up with a pink, blue, and yellow neon](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/d0cf922c-5eba-4def-9b80-a357fbedc7a2/315354136_803654817548272_8003030386132995900_n.jpg)

  Grand Theatre
  -------------

  The Grand Theatre is Stamford’s historic movie theatre located on the downtown Square. The theatre is proud to provide low-cost, high-quality movie entertainment for our community and the Texas Big Country. Visit their website at [**www.grandtheatrestamford.com**](https://www.grandtheatrestamford.com) for showtimes and upcoming movies.
* ![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/6076bb32-e409-4d2c-a335-fda857516df0/Lake_Stamford+texas.jpg)

  Stamford Lake and College Lake
  ------------------------------

  Stamford Lake is located 10 miles northeast of Stamford. It is a tributary of the Clear Fork of the Brazos River with a surface area of about 5,124 acres and a depth of about 36 feet. It is a prime location for boating, or simply just relaxing by the water. You can learn more about Stamford Lake and it’s features on the [**Texas Parks and Wildlife website**](https://tpwd.texas.gov/fishboat/fish/recreational/lakes/stamford/)**.** College Lake is located on the[**east side of town**](https://www.google.com/maps/place/College+Lake,+Texas+79553/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x86543124d5e4f051:0x541d9283cd344586?cshid=1719501085999564&ictx=111&sa=X&ved=1t%3A242) and is a smaller lake great for kayaking or fishing.

* ![interior of the round up hall stamford texas](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/0e5fffc2-c876-471b-bdb2-14cc1a69d662/Round+up+hall+stamford+texas.jfif)

  Western Swing Dances
  --------------------

  The city of Stamford is quickly becoming a hub of country and western swing dancing. The [**Stagecoach Event Center**](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100087773224593) as well as the historic [**TCR Old Timers Round Up Hal**l](https://www.facebook.com/RoundupHallStamfordTX) host regular dance events with some of the best western swing and country dance bands around. Visit and follow their Facebook pages for more info on upcoming events.
* ![Stamford Harmon Park in Stamford Texas](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/5f164eb8-d455-4e39-8192-ffc0b3ed2cf7/stamford+harmon+park.jpg)

  Local Parks and Recreation
  --------------------------

  Harmon Park and Washington Park provide our community with places for kids to play as well as walking tracks and pavilions for community gatherings. For more information about reserving our park spaces, please call the city offices at [**325-773-2723**](https://www.stamfordtx.org/325-773-2723)**.**
* ![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/ce8297cc-35b5-4351-9b65-88694ea62d80/cowboy+statue.jpg)

  Historical Landmarks
  --------------------

  Stamford is filled with various historical sites that will appeal to those interested in small town history and culture. You can see sites such as our Coke Park Mural just north of the square, the cowboy statue commemorating our western heritage heading west out of town, or the historic remains of the Stamford Inn built in 1900. Other notable sites include Arledge Field Airport and our Stamford Carnegie Library, both of which carry historical significance in our community.



![](https://images.squarespace-cdn.com/content/v1/645a5c250f356c56f6bd856a/fe0e5bfd-80f6-4c82-8239-ce04a08cba9d/Untitled+design+%285%29.jpg)
